person.content:
Please identify the "Person" entities in the following paragraph. Please present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Person". Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

Paragraph: On Monday and Tuesday , students from the institute and the university launched protests against what they said was unfair handling by police of a brawl between some of their colleagues and restaurant owners in October .

Let's think step by step.

| Person |
| --- |
| students |
| what they said was unfair handling by police |
| some of their colleagues |
| restaurant owners |

Note: I included all the groups that could potentially be considered as "Person" entities, even if some of them might be borderline cases. The most clear-cut entities are "students" and "restaurant owners", while "what they said was unfair handling by police" and "some of their colleagues" are more debatable, as they refer to actions performed by people or groups of people, but are not people themselves.

Please remove entities that do not clearly refer to "Person" and present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Person".

Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

| Person |
| --- |
| students |
| restaurant owners |

Note: I have removed the entities "what they said was unfair handling by police" and "some of their colleagues" as they do not clearly refer to a person or group of people.

location.content:
Please identify the "Location" entities in the following paragraph. Please present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Location". Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

Paragraph: On Monday and Tuesday , students from the institute and the university launched protests against what they said was unfair handling by police of a brawl between some of their colleagues and restaurant owners in October .

Let's think step by step.

| Location     |
|--------------|
| the institute |
| the university |
| October     |

The two "Location" entities found are "the institute" and "the university". These are locations because they refer to specific places where the students involved in the protest come from. The third entity, "October", is not a location and was not included in the table.

Please remove entities that do not clearly refer to "Location" and present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Location".

Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

| Location     |
|--------------|
| the institute |
| the university |

The only two entities that clearly refer to "Location" are "the institute" and "the university". The entity "October" was removed as it does not refer to a location.

organization.content:
Please identify the "Organization" entities in the following paragraph. Please present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Organization". Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

Paragraph: On Monday and Tuesday , students from the institute and the university launched protests against what they said was unfair handling by police of a brawl between some of their colleagues and restaurant owners in October .

Let's think step by step.

| Organization |
| --- |
| the institute |
| the university |
| police |

In this paragraph, the "Organization" entities are "the institute," "the university," and "police." These entities are organizations because they refer to groups of people who are associated with a particular institution or system. "The institute" and "the university" are educational organizations, while "police" is a law enforcement organization.

Please remove entities that do not clearly refer to "Organization" and present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Organization".

Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

| Organization |
| --- |
| the institute |
| the university |
| police |

In this paragraph, the "Organization" entities are "the institute," "the university," and "police." I have removed any entities that do not clearly refer to organizations. For example, "colleagues" and "restaurant owners" are not organizations, but rather groups of individuals. Similarly, "Monday" and "Tuesday" are not organizations, but rather days of the week.
